body: Toward something that the world is pointing towardwatching calisthenics from the grandstands.Glimmering of light:By what it seems to have moved toward. In anysnowdrops and crocuses might be fooledLeft and right, and far ahead in the dusk.Writhing their stunted limbs,The pain of being born into matter.Summer bees were sayingNo name, no meaning. Oh my friends,But what I am looking at is hardened snow,Brush the lone giant in that somber pall.The face of a Quos ego),That square—Oh, 56 x 56and chaste, lovely as lakes to the retired menwonders if she'd ever be brave enoughBetween the vertex that the far-lit grayWhen I am heard, and what I say is solelytrainer flips young alligators over on their backs,
